title: What makes BlackPink better than Red Velvet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Actually, I would contend that Red Velvet is better than Blackpink, when you consider the concepts which were introduced in the first two generations of K-pop, and how Blackpink and Red Velvet have adhered to these concepts in their careers. Here’s why I think so. In the earlier generations of K-pop, vocals and dancing were heavily emphasised, and there were few, if any, idols who could rap; fewer still who could rap well. There are exceptions to this, but in general vocals were the main focus back then. As such, a common trend which you see among earlier groups such as SHINee, Super Junior and SNSD is that their vocals were absolutely out of this world. In my opinion, no group today can EVER match up to how good vocals were back then. Fight me. Choose your fighter. I’ll pick Irene. (Hint: you won't win.) Red Velvet adheres to these principles well. They have a very strong vocal line, which is no surprise given that they are a SM group, which is notorious for placing vocals first when forming their groups. Their dancing is phenomenal, and if you ask me, they represent what it means to be a first or second-generation K-pop group, and it’s very surprising that despite their purist approach, their music has still been able to translate favourably into this new era of K-pop.  About the “new era of K-pop”. Let me explain what I mean by that. K-pop originated from Western pop culture. That is a fact. As such, as Western music and consumer tastes evolved, so did K-pop. Evolution is key to survival. I believe Darwin taught us that a few centuries ago. As the industry moved towards a more hip-hop and pop oriented music scene and more rappers began taking their place in the spotlight, rapping became more prominent in K-pop groups that were debuted later in the 2000’s. This meant that older groups who didn't exactly have the strongest rap line, fell into relative obscurity despite their ethereal vocals, as more and more groups debuted with one, two, sometimes three rappers in their lineups. Additionally, we now see more and more emphasis being placed on visuals. Admittedly, this is shallow, but it is necessary as K-pop begins to market itself globally, and having good music just doesn't cut it. It’s a shame, but sometimes the world would rather see a pretty face. Enter: Blackpink. I think that BLINKs calling Blackpink the revolution are merely alluding to how, with their unique style deliberately tailored to fit today’s tastes, Blackpink are making noise despite the massive differences between them and the groups of yesteryear. They don't have the best vocals or dancing. But what they do have is one of the strongest rap lines and pretty much the best visuals in the industry. They have appeal. They are fresh, catchy and exciting. And this is exactly what the market wants right now. As such, what we see is groups like Blackpink which, in catering to all these new things which fans want to see in newer groups, explode onto the scene and rise to fame without most of the virtues groups who came before them had. Which is why a lot of purists bash them, and call them overrated, but that’s another story. To answer your question: what makes Blackpink better than Red Velvet? Timing.  YG is a lot of things, but he is definitely not stupid. He reads the market like a book, and most of the time he knows when to debut groups when they appeal to fans the most. Blackpink are more popular now because in this age when the lines between Western and Korean pop become increasingly blurred, they are the group which have all of the things fans want to see in the new generation of K-pop. They are more easily relatable to Western audiences because of their fluency in English, and YG has certainly set them up to appeal to a global audience instead of merely Korea, which is where the focus of most groups has traditionally been placed. However, I would say Red Velvet is better. Here, I’m talking about it expressly from the standpoint of a K-pop purist. Red Velvet personifies what it means to adapt to survive. They have some of the strongest vocals around, a decent rap line, good choreography, amazing visuals, and did I mention their vocals? I would go so far as to say that if they debuted in the 2000’s, they would probably be the SNSD of that era. They’re that good. I would also say that if they debuted today, but focused solely on their Velvet concept, they'd be the biggest K-pop group around, rivalling BTS and probably beating Blackpink in worldwide fame. Before ARMYs come at me and say that no one can be compared to their boys, let me explain a few things. BTS has changed a lot throughout the years. They have adapted their music and concepts as times changed around them. For a group to do so which debuted near the end of the second generation of K-pop is amazing, and no small feat. However. Red Velvet is simply on another level when it comes to girl groups. Their vocals, Wendy and Seulgi, have voices on par to singers such as Ailee. Let that sink in. So it would be no surprise to see Red Velvet do great if they debuted today, sans duality. This is not to say that their duality is bad. I think it’s an important part of who they are as a group, but the truth is that in the industry, consumer tastes matter most. And right now, global consumer tastes don't exactly lean towards a more cutesy concept. That is a fact.  To sum it up: Red Velvet as a K-pop group is undoubtedly better than Blackpink. It’s not even a discussion we should be having. In my opinion, Red Velvet is the ONLY group around which is able to translate the principles of the first and second generations of K-pop so seamlessly into the current generation. They are in many ways the ideal group. However, if you were to ask me which group appeals to the masses the most right now, it would be Blackpink. In that respect, Blackpink wins, every time. Consumer tastes and timing. That’s all that really matters, in the end. And it’s a shame, really.

Neither group is better than the other. I know my credential says Blackpink was what brought me into Kpop, but I am in no way saying they are better than Red Velvet. It all depends on a person’s taste in music and I do not wish to compare the two groups. I am both a Blink and a Reveluv and it hurts when I see fandoms fight over which is better between different groups. So no. Red Velvet might have been around longer and have more songs than Blackpink, which is the reason some people like them more, but that doesn’t make them “better.” In my opinion, both groups have amazing talent, great rappers, and outstanding vocals, as well as beautiful visuals and excellent choreography (this is an OPINION, so please don’t attack me). So, that said, I will say again that neither group is better, and I will always do my best to keep fan wars from happening over these topics with any group. Each group has their own unique concepts and we should respect that. Even if you are a Reveluv or a Blink and you don’t like the other group between these too, you should still respect them. They have all worked hard to get to where they are, so nothing makes one “better” than the other.

Blackpink is not better than RV but each groups have their own specialties. Vocal= i think rv wins but rosé does have a great voice tho Rap= bp wins but tbh both of those groups are not really that great in my opinion Concept= well, idk if people will agree or not but this is just my opinion. I think rv is still better with concept because they have so much diversity and it fits them really well. I always think that diversity doesnt mean that the group is better because the concepts that they do dont always work well with them. But surprisingly, rv fits all of the different concepts that they tried. Meanwhile bp, well they havent showed much of themselves too since they debuted a few years after rv but by far they do have cool concept. But then again, it’s just “girl crush” concept and nothing more (not that it’s a bad thing cause i actually prefer girl crush than cute even tho both are good). Dance= meh, equal. Both are gods. But my ult is seulgi hehe.

Well… First, Blackpink is not “better” than Red Velvet. I don’t know why you think this way or who told you this bullshit, but no. Because, first, it’s awfully subjective and second, while being super objective, I really don’t see in what Blackpink is better than Red Velvet. Anyway. It’s useless to compare them. Their style are totally different. Blackpink is more in a Girl Crush concept with some hip-hop vibes and Red Velvet is an experimental group with a really special type, with pop and R&B undertones. That’s totally different. So nothing make Blackpink “better” than Red Velvet.

I assume you are going by people’s opinions, right? They think Blackpink is better mainly because everyone loves the girl crush concepts now, and their songs are catchy. All of the members are stunningly gorgeous, and for some reason, people love Rose’s voice (everyone has different tastes). The rap is quality and all. Stuff that makes Red Velvet better than Blackpink are the diverse concepts, Wendy’s ability of singing any genre, dance, songs that are catchy like diseases, and their history of rewards for basically every song. After looking at these, you choose which side you like, nothing bad is going to happen if you prefer Blackpink over Red Velvet ;).

Only one thing makes a group “better” than another: If you enjoy them more. Better is completely subjective. Sometimes fans use actual data like music show wins or album sales to claim superiority, but again, that’s not “better”. The real true point of pop music is to enjoy it, so just enjoy what you like and leave the things you don’t like alone. And maybe don’t ask leading questions like this, because as you can see you’ll get a lot of angry fans arguing with you. (for the record, I consider myself a fan of neither group. I’ve enjoyed some title tracks from both of them but I don’t follow them closely)

They’re both good in their own ways. You asking the question “What makes BLACKPINK better than Red Velvet?” makes it look like you’re stating facts when you’re, in fact, not. It’s a matter of opinion. People who like RV will choose RV, and people who like BP will choose BP. (and I don’t know why a girl group who has only 5 songs is considered “better” than a group who has more albums that BP’s songs. There’s not much evidence to even compare them.)

I think rather than “better”, I think it's a matter of more accessibility. 3 out of the 4 members in BLACKPINK speak English fluently while only one in Red Velvet does. In addition, all the members are Korean in Red Velvet, while one of the members of BLACKPINK is a foreigner. Not to mention their companies. SM has often been tried for their mistreatment of employees, while YG doesn't have such problems as frequently. There are other reasons, but rather than “better”, I do believe it would be more appropriate to use the word “accesibility”.

Back off, you Twitter kpop stans….. (Wait don’t attack me I’m sorry just making a joke) I mean I do stan BP more than RV, but that’s just a personal preference and also because I only started listening to RV recently. Blackpink is NOT better than Red Velvet! Both groups are very beautiful and very talented, and both also produce great music. It all comes down to who YOU prefer in terms of style, music type, etc. (Also, side note: these types of questions can trigger fans on both sides — please be careful when you post them.)

no offense, but such questions can lead to fan wars between the fandoms of both RV and BP, which have been happening quite a lot due to the competition people have created between them. hence, no one is better than the other. They’re both currently on top of the game and have given massive hits, have acclaimed great fame. im both a reveluv and blink, this I won’t be biased but factually, RV is dominating the kpop scene in Korea while BP is doing so outside of Korea. And this is because, BP has three members who were either born in another country or lived there for some time(expect Jisoo), while all the RV members are from SK. people many prefer RV over BP or BP over RV, but that’s a matter of music taste i.e subjective. Stop competing, they’re both serving so respect both of them, since it took a lot of hard work for them to be where they are today.

I don’t think there’s anything that makes BlackPink better than Red Velvet. I like BlackPink better because I have known them for longer and I also watch their other contents. I really don’t watch red velvet content. I just like BlackPink cause I know them better.

Neither. Being better is subjective. It depends on the individual person how he describes better. However, it is a human instinct to compare one from the other in order to boost their ego. Moreover, both girl groups have their own talent and skills. And that what makes redvelvet, redvelvet and blackpink,blackpink
Ugh….. nothing. Blackpink is too overhyped, and I personally prefer Red Velvet. NOTHING MAKES BALCKPINK BETTER THAN RED VELVET!!!!!!!!!!!!! Just my opinion. -Evelyn Medrano
Uhh, nothing. Both girlgroups are great in their own ways. Their concepts are different, the vibe is different…but they’re both great. No need to make stupid questions such as this one again.

Nothing actually. BLACKPINK and Red Velvet have their different talents. I personally think Red Velvet is better in terms of vocals and visuals while BLACKPINK is better in terms of rap and dance. This is just my opinion -They are spectacular in their own ways😌 ✌

In terms of vocals red velvet wins, Wendy's technique and her vocal range is excellent. Wendy has the most octaves out of every kpop female idol. Rose's technique is yg styled. You can't sing high notes like that or else your voice will be damaged. Rap Black pink wins by far… No one is sm can actual rap. Dance Lisa destroys everyone in rv. In terms of visual pretty equal seulgi Irene jisoo and Jennie are ranked in prettiest girls in kpop
